channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Multiple Law Enforcement Officers Are Shot in Charlotte, Police Say
item.description: Gunfire erupted on Monday afternoon as a U.S. Marshals task force conducted an investigation.

item.title: As the U.K. Tries Moving Asylum Seekers Offshore, Ireland Pushes Back
item.description: The Irish government said it was drafting emergency legislation to return asylum seekers to Britain, after seeing a surge of people leaving there for sanctuary in Ireland.

item.title: How to write an MBA resume that’ll help you get into business school
item.description: MBA resumes are similar to traditional job resumes, with a couple of key differences. Experts detail how to write one, what to avoid—and why.

item.title: Bob Bakish, Paramount CEO, Steps Down as Company Weighs Merger
item.description: Mr. Bakish was once a staunch ally of Shari Redstone, Paramount’s controlling shareholder. His departure comes as the company considers a major merger.

item.title: Israeli Strikes Hit Residential Buildings in Rafah
item.description: Several people were reportedly killed during Israeli airstrikes on the southern city of Rafah, Gaza, where more than a million displaced Gazans have fled.

item.title: Biden backs off long-awaited ban on menthol cigarettes
item.description: “This decision prioritizes politics over lives, especially Black lives,” said Yolonda Richardson of the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids, in an emailed statement.

item.title: As the U.K. Tries Moving Asylum Seekers Offshore, Ireland Pushes Back
item.description: The Irish government said it was drafting emergency legislation to return asylum seekers to Britain, after seeing a surge of people leaving there for sanctuary in Ireland.

item.title: Gérard Depardieu Ordered to Stand Trial in Sexual Assault Case
item.description: The actor, who has become a #MeToo flashpoint in France, will be tried in October over allegations that he sexually assaulted two women during a 2021 film shoot.

item.title: Business travel survives the Zoom era, as leaders jump back on flights
item.description: Even with Zoom’s implementation, employee travel bounds back to pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Universities Face an Urgent Question: What Makes a Protest Antisemitic?
item.description: Pro-Palestinian student activists say their movement is anti-Zionist but not antisemitic. It is not a distinction that everyone buys.

item.title: Philippines Closes Schools Because of Heat Wave, Jeepney Strike
item.description: Scorching temperatures coincided with a nationwide strike of jeepneys, the main mode of public transport in the country.

item.title: Millennials have it better than everyone thinks, accumulating wealth faster than anyone else since the pandemic, new data shows
item.description: “This historic growth is without parallel in recent decades,” according to an analysis from the Center for American Progress.

item.title: Deadline Passes but Columbia Students Remain in the Encampment
item.description: University officials gave the pro-Palestinian demonstrators a 2 p.m. deadline and threatened to suspend them if they did not leave.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Appears to Soften Stance in Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: Israel’s latest offer would accept fewer hostages to be freed during the first phase of a new truce in Gaza, officials said. Hamas has not commented on the proposal.

item.title: MedMen’s spectacular collapse is complete: Just five years after earning a whopping $3 billion valuation, the one-time legal cannabis darling has declared bankruptcy
item.description: “MedMen has been ‘DeadMen’ to most investors for a long time,” one industry analyst told Fortune.
